intro: Anthopterus ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian anthopterus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
